required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of OSTENIL PLUS (Hyaluronic Acid) Versus SYNVISC-ONE in Patients With Tibiofemoral Osteoarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of OSTENIL PLUS (Hyaluronic Acid) Versus SYNVISC-ONE in Patients With Tibiofemoral Osteoarthritis. A Randomised, Controlled, Double-blind, Parallel-group Study With a 6-month Follow-up

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of the study was to demonstrate the non-inferiority of the efficacy of a single intra-articular injection of OSTENIL PLUS compared to that of a single intra-articular injection of the reference product SYNVISC-ONE in the treatment of symptomatic tibiofemoral osteoarthritis. The primary endpoint was the change in mean score on the WOMAC pain scales from D0 to D180.

detailed_description.textblock:
After a period of washout-out for NSAIDs, the patients received a single intra-articular injection of OSTENIL PLUS or of SYNVISC-ONE in the most painful knee. The study involved a preselection visit at D-7 and five further visits: at D0 (baseline, evaluation before intra-articular injection), at D2 ± 2 days (injection), at D30 ± 15 days, at D90 ± 15 days and C5 at D180 ± 15 days.
To enrol the patients as quickly as possible, 129 sites, i.e. general medical or rheumatology practices, were open. After verifying the inclusion and exclusion criteria, the evaluating investigators assigned a randomisation number based on the chronological order of inclusion of patients at their site. The patient was then sent to the injecting investigator so that he/she could give the injection of the product corresponding to the randomisation number.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This study was a multicentre, prospective, double-blind, randomised, controlled non-inferiority study in two parallel groups of patients followed up for six months.
study_design_info.masking_description: To prevent the patients from knowing the nature of their treatment, the investigational products OSTENIL PLUS and SYNVISC-ONE were packed in identical neutral packs. OSTENIL PLUS and SYNVISC-ONE differ in appearance (product volume and viscosity, prefilled syringe) and were therefore readily identifiable by the investigator administering the investigational product (i.e. injecting investigator). The double-blind masking could be ensured thanks to the intervention of an observer who did not know the nature of the treatment, namely the evaluating investigator. The treatment was therefore administered blind to the evaluating investigator and the patient but not to the injecting investigator.

primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the pain subscore (section A) of the WOMAC score

secondary_outcome.description: Index assessing the severity of osteoarthritis
Stiffness subscore (section B) of the WOMAC score
Function subscore (section C) of the WOMAC score

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient's overall status score in relation to his/her knee osteoarthritis
secondary_outcome.description: Visual analogue scale assessed by the patient

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of overall treatment efficacy by the patient
secondary_outcome.description: 5-point scale (1 = very good; 2 = good; 3 = moderate; 4 = poor; 5 = very poor)

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of overall treatment efficacy by the investigator
secondary_outcome.description: 5-point scale (1 = very good; 2 = good; 3 = moderate; 4 = poor; 5 = very poor)

other_outcome.description: Recording of all adverse events and changes in concomitant treatments
Recording of adverse manifestations such as post-injection pain, inflammatory reaction, presence of hydrarthrosis, presence of acute pseudoseptic or septic arthritis

other_outcome.measure: Assessment of local treatment tolerability by the patient
other_outcome.description: 5-point scale scale (1 = very good, 2 = good, 3= moderate, 4 = poor, 5 = very poor)

other_outcome.measure: Assessment of local treatment tolerability by the investigator
other_outcome.description: 5-point scale scale (1 = very good, 2 = good, 3= moderate, 4 = poor, 5 = very poor)

other_outcome.measure: Assessment of overall treatment tolerability by the investigator
other_outcome.description: 5-point scale (1 = very good; 2 = good; 3 = moderate; 4 = poor; 5 = very poor)

other_outcome.measure: Assessment of overall treatment tolerability by the patient
other_outcome.description: 5-point scale (1 = very good; 2 = good; 3 = moderate; 4 = poor; 5 = very poor)

arm_group.description: A single intra-articular injection of sodium hyaluronate 40 mg/2.0 ml at Day 2, i.e. 2 days post Baseline (Day 0 = Week 0)
A single intra-articular injection of hylan G-F 20 48 mg/6 ml at Day 2, i.e. 2 days post Baseline (Day 0 = Week 0)

intervention.description: Injection into the joint cavity of the most painful knee
Injection into the joint cavity of the most painful knee
